caption: The ambience was appealing. The staff was great. The drinks where just right. Veggies and risotto was nice. 25 dollar Salmon was a but over cooked....
Great atmosphere and service. Baked potato was a little cold but overall very nice

While we have had fantastic meals at Capitol Cellars, I wanted to bring to your attention first before posting a public review the quality of Christmas Dinner. We ordered dinner for 4 and picked up the meal at 3pm Christmas Eve. I was very excited to have this meal as the prime rib I’ve had before at Capitol Cellars was delicious. This was not the case this time, as the Prime Rib slices were full of gristle and the flavor was off. The potatoes were not cooked all the way, completely raw on the bottom and I had to add cheese to it for more flavor. The winter vegetables were flavorless and the yellow sauce on it was butter???? Not sure, flavorless. The salad had a lot of brown pieces in it and there was a hair in with the rolls. The soup was delicious, as was the cheesecake. For spending $236 + $50 dollar cash tip for the staff, this was disappointing and almost inedible.  Just figured someone might want to know as I see your doing the same thing for a NYE package which we will not be ordering. Photos for your review. ***I sent this exact email to Management GM??? giving 7 days to respond and did not hear a word back. Nothing. Almost $300 and we basically had 1 cup of soup/person and 1 piece of cheesecake/person for out Christmas Dinner, the rest was inedible.
Got both my orders wrong. I will give them another chance

Pick-up was seamless, the re-heating instructions were concise - and the meal dramatically exceeded our expectations: a generous portion of ham, among the best au gratin potatoes either of us could remember, a vegetable, focaccia bread, and an amazing chocolate gateau (with two sauces) for dessert.

I went to Capitol Cellars recently with a group and had a lovely time during happy hour on their patio. The food (Halloumi fries) were pheromonal! And while we all sipped on different beverages, I enjoyed the 2C pinot gris. It was refreshing and hit the spot after a long day of work! Will be back soon!

The food (Halloumi fries) were pheromonal! And while we all sipped on different beverages, I enjoyed the 2C pinot gris. It was refreshing and hit the spot after a long day of work! Staff was attentive and despite COVID-19 pandemic, I always felt safe and like safety measures were being properly followed by all employees.
Excellent Brunch. Prime Rib Sandwich was excellent.

The atmosphere is amazing.  I'm always on the hunt for a great steak and they didn't disappoint! I would have given 5 stars if our server would have been a bit more attentive.  My beverage sat empty for 10 min. My 16 oz prime rib was close to $40 and it tasted great but the service needs to warrant the price. I would definitely come back for the prime rib.

Cool atmosphere in a great downtown location. Wait staff were friendly, but actual service was subpar... Took our order, came back 5-10 minutes later to retake our order and then still missed several items, the appetizers came at the same time the meal came. Food was well plated, but lacked flavor - not bad, but not good either except the creme brulee and chocolate tart (both excellent flavor). Would not recommend. Two stars because of the heated toilet seat :)

The French onion soup was bland. My prime rib and baked potato were cold. Sent it back and the prime rib came back still cold. The prices are high end but the food mediocre. Won’t go back. Very expensive for the quality. I’d rather pay a bit more and have incredible food at Chandlers. Great room though.
We like the patio situation these days and we like the food and especially the service. Cheers!
Fun old Boise atmosphere and super menu.
Jacob was our waiter. I spent my 30th bday here. Did a fantastic job. The food was excellent and what a great environment. Highly recommended.

By far the worst quality of food we have ever had for the price.  We have been to most of the high end restaurants in boise. Chandler's barbacoa. Asiagos, gino's, baccquest's.  The Prime rib was dry and overcooked  to the point it was chuwy when I ordered it medium rare. My wife ordered the salmon and risotto. Salmon was very dry with no seasoning. The risotto was cooked to the point it was mushy and sticky and bland.  We will never come back  again .we had such high hopes for this restaurant. Its in a beautiful build.  If you are traveling to boise there are so many other amazing places to eat.
Amazing atmosphere and food!
Wonderful food and great service.
Absoutely delicious food. Fantastic service. A bit spendy, but that’s expected at a restaurant of this caliber right downtown. Would recommend.
Amazing environment, friendly and knowledgeable staff, even better food for a reasonable price. Would recommend for a classy business meeting or a romantic date night.

Unfortunately, my experience there did not amount to what I anticipated. I chose to eat at the restaurant in celebrating a personal achievement, gaining entrance into law school. My first impression with the service was that my hostess was snooty, after I inquired information regarding seating in light of COVID-19. As for the price of the food, it is undoubtedly overpriced. The presentation was wonderful, but after the first bites of their special steak, it was unsavory and undercooked to the temperature I had requested. One of the most underwhelming and most expensive steak dinners I have had in the Treasure Valley. Very disappointed and frankly, I will never go back.

As we quarantine, we need, now more than ever before, the comfort of good food. While Capital Cellars is on our regular round of dining, we also consider it a special occasion spot. After checking out their special Easter menu, my bro and I decided it would be a good choice for our Easter dinner.
Prime rib was really good, especially being offered during the week.
The food was really good! We sampled food from all areas of the menu and it was all delicious! Service was very helpful and friendly. Great birthday dinner! We'll be back 😊
Great food, friendly service and a beautiful dining room in an historic building. Highly recommended.

What a wonderful experience this past week dining throughout different restaurants of Boise, Idaho but this was by far my favorite. Amazing service & food, our waiter provided outstanding service & recommendations, lovely presentation & a flavor filled meal all around. Must try!!

Valentine's Day/Retirement special occasion dinner....Sat down right @ 5:00 reservation time. Seeing later tables being served, had to ask for a server @ 5:15 to get cocktails which were good. Got red balloon glasses for a chard. Server poured away, no tasting that $100 bottle. I ordered lamb chops, got the pork. Food presentation poor and food very salty. Second bad experience here, we're out.

Unimpressed. Ambiance kinda fun, Drinks good, Wine good, Appetizer OK, service SLOW, entrees boring. Steak was a really lousy piece of meat w/ some kinda gross cooked down sauce. Didnt do dessert, had waited too long. Granted, it was Valntines day, the worst day in the food industry to go out. But for the money, it was a big let down and should have been much better. May be willing to try again when not so busy and not for dinner.

Valentine’s Day’s prefix menu was most disappointing. French onion soup should never be so broths with crunchy  onion. Prime rib should be served with some flavor without having to smear raw horseradish just to void grainy rare meat. I had a high expectation but I am sorry to say, I was highly disgusted.
Food was not worth the price we paid. All 3 courses left is wanting. On the plus side, the beer was good

I couldn’t wait to try this restaurant the atmosphere is very nice and cozy. We ordered an appetizer first and waited at least 40 min. Another couple came in and sat behind us they ordered their meal and also an appetizer. They had already gotten their appetizer and then their meal and we still had not even got our appetizer. The appetizer was pretty good. Then we waited another 40 min for our main dishes. We asked for bread it came without butter. I guess they don’t normally serve bread. The main dishes were not good the chicken was pretty dry. The mashed potatoes were under seasoned and cold the cauliflower which was their special vegetable was supposed to be roasted it was barely blanched still raw and not seasoned or buttered and was not roasted at all. The au gratin potatoes were so salty you couldn’t even eat them. Lamb chops two were not even cooked. I was wondering why we waited so long for the undercooked cold food. Such a huge disappointment! They asked if we wanted dessert which should have been on the house after waiting over an hour for our meal. But was not offered to us in that way. Sadly we will not be returning.

Ambiance is fantastic, appetizers were good, entrees were underwhelming, service was great.  Restaurants are about the food first and foremost, so I weighted that aspect more than the others.   We would return for drinks and apps, but we get few dinners out and we probably will not do another full dinner here.

Very old-school menu. Service was pretty abysmal. Steak both overpriced and  overcooked. The ambience is cool, a brick-walled tiny space full of nooks and crannies and Capital memorabilia. The food and service were just disappointing, especially for the prices.
It was okay.  Had the meal deal.  Small portions but nice ambiance.
username: La Terraza Guest House B&B Costa Rica

caption: Best restaurant ever. Fabulous food & service. Love your restaurant Logan!

Here is a hidden gem in Boise. A political themed menu in the basement of a downtown building. Great staff and excellent food.  I was quite pleased with my entire dining experience.  I will go back and looking forward to bringing friends for a lively debate over some delicious Idaho based food
A lovely environment with as many local ingredients as possible and the friendliest staff available.
This is a beautiful restaurant with wonderful food and wine! Thank you!
Always good!
Good food beautiful place, awsome wait staff
Lots of Aviance
Cool atmosphere, I had the salmon entree which was good but I would like to see a more creative menu.
Delicious meal and terrific service.  Came with large group which was handled very well by management.
If you are old and stuffy, this may be your place. Probably ought to be from Eagle too. This place is the opposite of cool.
Not a big wine person but went with work. Service was good and environment nice. Nothing really stood out to me though.
Great place. Live the food and service
I work here
Great food, great service
Fast friendly service.  Reuben sandwich with Rosemary fries...yummmm!

The sandwich was nothing special to write about. Unfortunately the sandwich was delivered with a heavy hand of aioli which took away from the sandwich. The fries were ok as they got very soggy quickly given the herbs they added to the fries. The jambalaya was not jambalaya imo. The rice...errr..risotto was cooked separately it seemed and was heavy on the butter and rich chicken stock.
Was not impressed...good but so so

Cozy atmosphere, attentive service, and wonderful food!  Enjoyed several meals here during my stay in Boise.   Capitol Cellars is a jewel!  Fresh and flavorful ingredients, a lovely presentation, and perfect portion sizes — clearly a well-trained chef is in the kitchen.  You won’t be disappointed here!
Fun brunch location, rather dark atmosphere inside but good food and service. The Monte Cristo was incredible! Also, I love the Capitol/legislative/historical theme. Super fun!
Good
Great food. Cool enviroment.

We went there to celebrate our wedding anniversary, I had the pork chops which were 1/16 of an inch high and were tough and dry the twice baked potato was baked ten times and the 25-cent string beans were rubbery. It was very expensive for shit food$$$ .Do not go there!!!

One of my favorite spots to eat in Boise due to the food and the atmosphere.  The exposed sandstone walls and legislative/supreme court theme is fun. I've been there many times with many people and nobody I've been with has ever had 1 complaint.  The Borah Burger with the balsamic reduction is easily top 5 burgers I've ever had.  The staff is very friendly and provide excellent service.
Wonderful experience, great food,great service. Prime local meats,  A must stop.
This our favorite restaurant. Excellent food, outstanding service.
Food generally consistent, good service
Wonderful restaurant.  Cozy, great service, great wine list and excellent food.
Great meal in a cool, historic spot. Very romantic atmosphere with great wine room.
Great drinks and food.
Evening service. Love the venue.

A  quaint little restaurant that is adorable, has a very good customer service,  and excellent food! I would recommend this to anyone who has the chance to stop by.  It was all that old difficult to find however I  the experience made up for it 10 fold.
Great atmosphere. Food was great and service was friendly.

Had a wonderful experience. The food was delicious and the service was first class. I honestly can say I've never had service from any place as good as we had tonight. Huge thanks to the manager for all of his help tonight. We had a little bit of a wait for the food but the manager made up for it and exceeded all of our expectations! Thanks so much. Highly recommend this place!

Stopped in at the end of lunch one day and couldn’t be more happy with my experience. Food was excellent, delicious French onion soup and sandwich. Service was attentive, but relaxed and I was able to work for a hour with their good WiFi. Cool space downstairs.
Very friendly good food and wine
Great place, get the beggars purse if you can
Such amazing service and the creme brulee was fantastic. I can't say enough how welcomed we felt. It's a strange thing to come from Seattle and wonder why we can't get anything remotely like this.

I had heard a lot of good thing about Capitol Cellars so was really excited to go for a date night with my wife. I have never been more disappointed in my life with a restaurant as I was with our experience. What we got was an overpriced dinner of dry/bland sea bass and chicken. The rice had zero seasoning and the same could be said of the pasta that came with the chicken. My wife had to ask for the marinara sauce just to eat any of the pasta. I will not be recommending Capitol Cellars to any of my friends for the amount of money spent ($100).
Such a nice place! Very delicious food, good service. Good for fancy romantic dates, has that nice atmosphere. 😊
Very nice ambiance. Attentive service.  Potato croquettes were delicious!   I will definitely go back.

We had an early evening reservation. We were early but got seated right away. We ordered a nice bottle of red. We also received a complimentary appetizer. We ordered 3 appetizers to share. They where all unique and very tasty. We had 3 different seafood dinners with a nice bottle of Viognier. It all tasted very great and we even enjoyed 2 desserts that were great. This was my Third visit for dinner. All very enjoyable. Service is great and atmosphere is awesome. My next visit will be for brunch. They have added that to their offerings. Also an outside patio. This is so far my favorite restaurant in Boise. Pricing is very fair.
The food is good and the staff is very friendly
Good menu
Nice cozy place with hearty breakfast foods.

The food was absolutely amazing. Their service could deffinatly use some work. We were 1 of 3 tables dining inside and experienced longer than expected wait time for drinks and to have our order taken.
Excellent lunch and atmosphere. Great service.
Excellent menu and even better service... great dinner experience.
Excellent food, too loud for conversation.

The food is mediocre. $24 for a sea bass, some bland rice and 8 green beans. My waitress was ok. I order a soup and salad for me, I said I will have a soup and salad, and she took off and didn't take my wife's appetizer order. When she came back I had to say that was just for me, my wife needs to order. She left and brought out our salad and didn't ask what we had wanted to order for our main course. When she brought our soup that's when I said can we order our main course.  The soup, French onion, was very watered down. I've had some very nice French onion soup and this was not very good at all. We won't be going back
Very classy! Wonderful food. Cooks do a damn good job here!! Kate is such a sweet server! Definitely recommend!

Honest review Went to eat down town Boise. Over cooked under seasoned first grilled chicken pasta for the 25 super under seasoned bland my son pushed the chicken to the side and said this is gross. They re did the chicken seasoned it better but over cooked it and dried it out also left a small bone in it.  New York strip 40$ asked for medium rare it was cooked to a medium-medium well under seasoned bleh. The potatoes where good so was the asparagus. Steak of the Union  The only thing I liked was the halloumi cheese fries 8$  Main reason I'd rather cook at home then go out to eat  90$ wasted after tip.
Yummy coffee and awesome soups! The best french onion soup I've ever had. The interior is rad and our server was the best!!
Great food, great service,  wonderful atmosphere! We will be back
Very good food and wait staff is great.

I should have ordered the prime rib.  Last Saturday evening our company had a staff dinner in the private room of Capitol Cellars. This basement level restaurant is highly rated and gives homage to many of its past Idaho political figures.  Since we were a large group, we were offered a prix fixe menu. We had a choice between a caesar salad or french onion soup for a starter. Then we chose among a locally raised barramundi (fish), prime rib, or a three-cheese and chicken pasta. Finishing with a choice between diablo cake or creme brulee.  Bob and I both enjoyed the french onion soup. The bowls were generously topped with a thick piece of baguette covered in oven-melted cheese. The broth was a tad bit sweet due to the variety of onions used.  I tried the fish entree, which the waiter had really encouraged. Apparently the barramundi is a variety of sea bass that can either be raised in saltwater or freshwater. This fish is grown in a geothermal body of water north of Boise. The state is also very proud of the sturgeon they raise in these waters that lucratively provide cash crops of high-end caviar. This story encouraged me to try the fish, but it was disappointing. The piece of fish was pretty small, not much flavor, and was fried a little too much. Bob had the chicken pasta dish. It was incredibly rich, resembling a really creamy alfredo. Those who ordered the prime rib were really impressed! I'm so sad I didn't order that.  The diablo cake was decadent. Although not a devil's food cake nor spicy in nature as the name might suggest, this flourless chocolate torte really hit the spot! We had a bite of a neighbor's creme brulee, and it was excellent!  When I return, I promise to try the beef option!
Food was excellent and the service was too!

Capital Cellars has an old-world charm, warm, inviting, it feels like you're walking into your favorite restaurant- and it might become just that!.  It's Very cozy, perfect for a romantic meal or for entertaining clients. The staff is welcoming, the food top notch, the wine impeccable.
Have been here and it gets better every time.  Great staff and food.  Worth the visit.
Ambiance is outstanding
Wonderful food, great surroundings,  awesome service.
Went for Saturday brunch and had the burger, which was amazing. We will be back the next chance we get. Looking forward to the dinner menu and wine list.
Great atmosphere, great food, great service. Highly recommend. A little spendy, but worth it!!  It can be a romantic dinner place or meet the girls for drinks place.  Love it!  I will be back again!
Great food, wonderful warm atmosphere. Service was superb...highly recommend.
Great food.. great service!!
lovely lunch spot

(Translated by Google) I did not like the service, it seemed like we were not welcomed, it was a strange atmosphere, coffee is good and the place is nice cozy, it is in a historic building right in the center of town!  (Original) Eu não gostei muito do atendimento, parecia que não éramos bem vindos, ficou um clima estranho,  café é bom e o lugar é bom aconchegante, fica em um prédio histórico bem no centro da cidade!
This restaurant is banging. Excellent prices and quality food. The place is great and the people are friendly as hell. Awesome theme too.
Steak melted in mouth the ragu was amazing. Highly recommend
Great food & wine, super service!
Great food.good wine selection. The pork chop is amazing.
Great Service and great food, had to order more to get full though.
Very good, noisy when crowded but very nice  fun place.  On the pricey side but you get what you pay for. Great staff
Great food and excellent service
Great service. Very good breakfast.
I LOVE this place!  Small, great food, excellent service! Perfect for any occasion!!
Great steaks and service. The only thing I didn't like about this place is the extremely low ceiling.
Great food upscale

Delicious food and the food is presented very nicely.  Nice menu selections - something for everyone.  The soups are the best and reasonably priced.  The well drinks are two ounce pours (hence the little higher cost) and the wine selection is amazing and priced appropriately (my very nice Malbec was $11.00; same as everywhere else).  Great atmosphere.  Our server Katherine R. was very pleasant and helpful.  Will return.
Their breakfast is the absolute best in Boise! Yummy drinks too :)
Amazing, tasty food! The french onion soup is the best we have tasted in this area. It does cost a little more, but well worth it.
Always awesome
My tied for favorite restaurant in Boise! The setting is beautiful, the seasonal flavors are wonderful, and the teapots are perfect. I especially love the French onion soup.
The sea bass was amazing & the service was excellent, highly recommended!
Hidden gem restaurant old downtown Boise with a fun, upscale menu. You have to try their homemade jams! Great service and quality food. Breakfast/ lunch must-try!
Good food! Drinks were excellent also! Love the atmosphere.
Super service. Excellent wine list n appetizers
It’s a pretty environment. My husbands tall chair leg was broken. It took over 2 hours to get our food. It took 1 hour 15 mins for Hors d’oeuvres. Won’t come back

These folks are top-notch! Hosted our son's graduation party here in an amazing private cellar room and it was like being in Portland. Very high end menu and our every need was taken care of by the staff. Highly recommend talking to Logan if you have need for a special event. She is definitely the best!
Phenomenal experience and the best Australian Sea Bass I've ever eaten. A must try if you're visiting Boise!
Reasonable and great tasting lunch!
Amazing meal, fantastic service
Great food ! Small portions.
Yummy food, delightful atmosphere

The best way to describe this place is: Nothing is wrong, just there is better (Richards, Alivita, etc). The food is good, upscale and reasonably priced. Their goat cheese appetizer is especially good. The drinks leave quite a lot to be desired, especially for the price. (Normally at places like this an old fashioned will have a single rock, not soda ice). The atmosphere is nice, they are defiantly trying for cozy, but is way to bright for that.
Good personal place. Food excellent as well as service

The food is TOP CHOICE! Our server, Kenna, was charming and on point. We got to share a laugh with the owner, Skip Smyser, who is just as charismatic and funny as reputed! Easily in my top 3 choices for quality dining experiences in downtown. I WILL be back soon.
Loved it, great food and great atmosphere
The service and food was like eating in France——as good as it gets
Great for an upscale dinner

Nice side walk dining area, excellent wait staff, food was very good. Wait staff also called us after dinner as a flash drive have fallen out of my wife's purse and walked it out to our car in the street to return it. A nice experience all around.
Simply amazing. Our waiter was the best, funny and helpful. Food, specifically the salmon, was incredible. And you gotta have the bread pudding.  The malbec was so delicious.  Highly recommend!

Love this place- it's romantic, it's small, it's got a fantastic wine selection, and I've never had a meal there that I didn't rave about the next day.  Try the Monte Cristo for lunch or the Bison-tennial short ribs for dinner. Holy yum.

We don't get into town for dinner that often and when we do, we've had our share of over rated new venues.  Our Boise friends who invited us down for a show, know their way around the local eateries but had not tried yet tried out Capitol Cellars.  We were all delightfully impressed!  The  limited menu was varied, so we all got to try something different.  Each was prepared and presented with care.  The wait staff were impeccable and their recommendations spot on!  A truly enjoyable experience.  Prices are on the higher end, especially for their domestic wines, but it was money well spent.    I think I had the best prime rib of my life and even our veggie leaning companions were blown away by their choices.  It was the highlight of our evening out!
Classy place, great Idaho and Boise themed food--order the croquettes!!!

After getting off a 7-hour flight from the northeast, the last thing I wanted to do was to venture out into the hot, summer sun for dinner. But I had no regrets once I was seated! The surrounding trees around this place made it comfortable to sit outside, and our wonderful waiter, Stephen, made sure we were served promptly and that our food was cooked to our liking. I highly recommend the filet mignon (a seasonal), which was buttery soft and barely required any effort to cut apart. The loaded baked potato isn't anything to scoff at either. I would highly recommend this place for a comfortable meal that will impress and deliver on quality and service speed.
We had an amazing prime rib and steak fillet.  Outdoor seating was perfect this time of year.  Can't wait to go back and work my way through the appetizer menu.

We visited Capital Cellars today for breakfast...food and service were great.  They have a good selection of breakfast items, specializing in quiches; which we did not try!  This was our first visit; planning on returning in the near future for dinner!
Good wine and good food
Everyone was knowledgeable and friendly.. and the prime rib fantastic! Every time I visit Boise, I make sure this spot is on my agenda.
Very charming place.  The asparagus salad was very good.  Great place for a treat.

A high end (price) establishment with a small menu but excellent flavor. Borah burger was very good and cooked as ordered. Everyone enjoyed their choice if either Burger, salmon on risotto, or ham and egg sandwich.

Breakfast was delicious! Had the omelet with ham, zucchini and gouda. Great taste, cooked to perfection.  Corned beef and hash was excellent.  Lots of meat and not many potatoes. Coffee was strong but not bitter. Excellent service.
Amazing food and great service!  I've tried several dishes and each has had a unique flavor.  Perfect intimate date night atmosphere.  Make a reservation to ensure a great dining experience!

I don't normally write reviews, but is worth the time. I came here for breakfast,l. Best egg, ham, fondue cheese breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Breakfast is usually pretty simple, but they didn't forget presentation, preparation, or service. I'm about it. 👌

Short menu but delicious food! Plenty wine to choose from. We ordered steak, salmon and trout. All delicious. Awesome service and there is a function room can hold large size party. Couldn’t be happier

(Translated by Google) My husband reserved a table to celebrate our anniversary, it exceeded our expectations the quiet place without noise to be able to converse, the stone walls, the table with the very nice white tablecloth, variety of drinks, the exquisite food and with good presentation, the excellent service, smiling and nice people, the waiter who attended us I think his name is Steve well attended, my husband asked him to take some pictures and at all times it was nice and when he took us a beautiful dessert that said Happy Anniversary on us He said in Spanish, Happy Anniversary, we all loved it, we wish to return soon.  (Original) Mi esposo reservó una mesa para celebrar nuestro aniversario,superó nuestras expectativas el lugar tranquilo sin ruido para poder convesar,las paredes de piedra,la mesa con el mantel color blanco muy lindo,variedad de bebidas,la comida exquisita y con buena presentación,el servicio excelente,las personas sonrientes y agradables,el mesero que nos atendió creo que se llama Steve bien atentó,mi esposo le pidió que nos toma unas fotografías y en todo momento fue agradable y cuando nos llevó un hermoso postre que decía Happy Anniversary el nos dijo en español,Feliz aniversario,todo nos encantó,deseamos regresar pronto.

We came for New Years Eve before the Potatoe Drop. It was fantastic, great service and excellent atmosphere.  They had a fixed menu but there were enough options even so. We do not eat pork or seafood so a fixed menue can be challenging. We had no issues. The deserts were also very tasty.

Learn from my mistake and get there early.  They only make a certain amount of appetizers and the steak of the day (they call it something else) is limited.  I made the mistake of reading the menu an hour before our reservation and planning my decadent meal.  Everything I wanted was gone by the time we sat down for our meal.  My expectations dashed. 😢  The staff was very kind, and took a dessert and an appetizer off the bill since my main course (steak) and two of the three appetizers our group wanted were no longer available.  I appreciated that.  I did enjoy my appetizer and my soup, but I was still hungry when I got home.  I also have a hard time hearing and this place is loud.  They also do not serve spirits.  Great wine and kind staff.
Great food  and service a little loud hard to talk

I took friends and clients for dinner Monday night! The food was amazing and the service was exceptional!! I loved the atmosphere and the vibe so much that this is my new favorite!! I’m anxious to go back and try other dishes and share the experience with others! 5 Stars!!!
Steak was chewy.
State of the steak was excellent. Terrific wine list.

We had dinner with friends at Capital Cellars. It was one of the best meals we have had in Boise.  The French onion soup was amazing. The Ribeye steak we had was delicious especially when paired with the German wine we chose.  To top it off was a delectable chocolate cake with raspberries.  We will definitely return.
Great food and a classy place. However service is really slow

This was our second time there and second review. The first review was glowing. Not so good Friday night. In all fairness, the food was superb and our personal server was nice. But the evening did not start well. I had made reservations but did not realize they had any bar height tables and chairs which I don't care for. There is one, and we were seated there. We were told that was all that was available. There was a table set for 4 next to it, and we assumed it was reserved for a party of 4. Five minutes later a young couple arrived. They quickly cleared 2 places off the table for 4 and sat the 2 of them there. The noise level was also quite high. We had a fairly loud party of 6 sitting next to us, and the place was full, so the noise detracted from the intimacy of the meal. There was a blonde lady/hostess kind of wandering around, and she was rather snippy with my friend. After dinner when we were leaving, my friend asked for a toothpick. Same lady gave him a very nasty look before handing one to him. Seems like when you have just laid down $70+, you should be treated better than snide looks. We won't go back. Will only recommend with caveats.
Food was amazing and it's so cute inside
Fabulous food and great service. If you have not eaten here, it is your loss. A+++

My only complaint (and more my hubby's) is that they only serve beer and wine, no liquor. The food was unbelievable. We stopped in in the last night of a 10 road trip and I had the Ways and Means (pasta with pork belly) and hubby had the daily Steak of the Union. Both amazing. Would definitely stop by again the next time I'm in Boise!
Great food, classy setting and awesome service.
Friendly staff. Excellent appetizers and food. I really enjoyed the wines. Huge wine list.
Never heard of this place......got invited and now many more will hear about it. Great in every respect.

We just celebrated our 33 year aniversry at Capitol Cellars Restaurant in Boise. A very enjoyable experience. Wonderful food and service. The Bison Short Ribs were so delicious and tender, we will have to go back for more. Thank you, Gary and Dee

We celebrated an anniversary here last week and loved it! The restaurant itself is unique, with beautiful stone walls and furnishings with a local political flavor. We were treated quite well by the manager and server, and the chef offered complimentary tastings of a delicious soup. We ordered the Steak of the Union, which was cooked medium perfectly and delicious, and the Ways and Means which is one of the top three pastas I've ever had in Boise. We hope this jewel sticks around!
Excellent food, great service, and outstanding atmosphere!
Best pork tenderloin in town!

What a neat place! Wonderful staff, even the family that owned it was hanging out and came to introduce themselves to us. A vintage building that shows its heritage, unique themed decor, and soon-to-be a quaint patio. Both of our meals were impeccable through three courses, and the wine was well paired thanks to our server. I love that they have lots of local Idaho wines on the menu, as well as local beef. Go after 6pm for free parking too.

Sat in the wine cellar, which was wonderful! Good wine list and food had fun names and was delish! I had cheese charcuterie plate which was too much for one person. Some in our group got the filet which they said was tender and flavorful. Two gala split the salmon plate and had Beet salad and lived it. Did I mention their wine list is thorough and varied? Easy walk to capitol and downtown area.
Got here at 8:30 and were already out of all their quiche and weren't making more.  It took 25 minutes to get dry hard scones.  Will not return.
Great service. Lovely atmosphere.  Fabulous food and wine! The salmon was amazing!
Old building,  great food.  Wish better parking
The food is great. The atmosphere is very comfortable. Very clever. The prices are good as well. The service is attentive without interruption.
Lighthearted event, pleasant people, charming location.
Hard to find but worth it
"The food is always tasty, though sometimes the seasoning is a bit heavy-handed."
Goldy's has great breakfast food. I had an omlette -- chock full of fresh ingredients. Love the atmosphere. Sit in the balcony if you enjoy people watching.
If you are looking for an upscale restaurant experience and seeking to impress this is the perfect choice! The menu is sophisticated and loaded with exquisite choices.

I enjoy trying new restaraunts especially downtown, so for Valentine's Day I decided to take my wife out. I surprised her by taking her to Capital Cellars, unfortunately it seems the surprise was on me. The experience was one to forget! Our server was awful and the food was just as bad. Every single dish we received was cold, I actually at one point told our server who then brought out a cold entree. A $250 bill is what we ended up paying for this night out. I would not recommend this restaraunt to anyone, which is very unfortunate because it was a great atmosphere and potentially could have been an excellent experience.
Whether you are going for their afternoon tea or a romantic dinner, their food and drinks are fantastic and the ambiance is unique and inviting. Definitely recommend!
Just try any sandwich you will love it, all are very good, try tomato basil soup with grilled cheese sandwich, DK Sodas
They had a tuna wellington the other night that was a pleasant surprise, very good with their spinach and mushrooms

My husband and I were in town for the night as he was covering a game. I found this place on Yelp and was really excited to give it a try!  We were seated promptly and (unfortunately) were next to a loud, rowdy, very drunk group of women. We couldn't hear each other talk across the table because of how loud they were. I asked our waitress if it would be possible for us to move and she was so nice and accommodating about it. The staff apologized to us for the situation (which wasn't even their fault) and brought us out a free appetizer. That really impressed me.  The food was delicious. We got the fondue to start, I ordered the Ways and Means pasta, my husband ordered the burger. All were excellent.
Food was fair service okay.
Wonderful food and unparalleled atmosphere. They pork-bellied our bill, seemingly by accident, by three salmon dinners. Check twice.
Little more speedy but definitely good food.
I'm glad I was able to eat here! The atmosphere was nice, and the food was fantastic. I highly recommend to anyone who eats here to try the prime rib.

A unique and pleasant fine-dining experience.  Tucked away just off the beaten path under an unassuming stone apartment building, Capitol Cellars offers modern local fare presented unpretentiously as real food, rather than meals of reconstructed cubes, flakes, pools and drizzles that have largely supplanted what is now considered "delicious".  The atmosphere is quiet and thoughtful, breathing life back into throw-away artifacts from Idaho legislative history into functional conversation pieces.  Not a place for overblown elaborative cocktails, the wine list extensive; the bottle collection lines the walls and adds to the ambience. Service is prompt yet unintrusive, modest, while refined.  This establishment is a gem hopeful to become an institution.
Excellent service and even better food. We will be back.

Celebrated our anniversary there.  Love the look and feel of the place. Very classy and romantic.  The staff was great and the meal (prime rib) was off the charts WONDERFUL!!! We will be back again and again.
The political theme was a huge turn off. This paired with the elevator music was a bit odd for such a cute cellar location. However, the food was wonderful.

We came here for our Valentine's Day dinner. They had a special menu for this evening. It was pretty expensive for this special meal and will not return on holidays, but will return on a regular business day. The food was delicious specifically the Prime Rib. Portion size were perfect amount and we were satisfied. I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant.  I gave it a 4 star due to the slow service. I almost fell asleep during my meal.
They win for deliciousness. Nice ambience. Glad we finally tried it. We will be back!
A boutique wine cellar located in the basement of a historic downtown Boise building. Good tastings and good food.
Love the Idaho Political history motif
